column5: Jean-Georges' casual yet chic restaurant features amazing Mediterranean dishes, balanced cocktails, and impressive ambiance. The crab toast and brick oven pizza are amazing. And there is even a tree in the dining room for extra special flare!

beautiful decor (not shocked) and ambiance. fantastic service and wonderful food. we were a large group, which I know is annoying for the waitstaff, but they were amazing. especially in a large group, I encourage sharing of some of the whole wheat crust pizzas. we sampled the brussels sprouts (might sound odd, but was great), spinach with goat cheese and regular tomato and mozzarella. for the main I had sea bass which was delicious, although I would have preferred a bit more veggies and starch in the dish (yes I know there are some served as sides). we also ordered a bunch of desserts but the cookie plate was the favorite by far. at the table, everyone enjoyed the duck and cheeseburgerI didn't realize this was a Jean-Georges joint, but it certainly lived up to his reputation. highly recommended!

Came here for lunch recently. The vibe of this place is warm and comfortable. But the service could have been better. After seating at the table, no one showed up for 10-12 minutes. Our server was great. He gave good recommendations about the salad. I ordered lavender peach kombucha which was amazing. We then ordered chicory and fig salad which was served with manchego cheese. It was delicious. Highly recommend to try it. I also ordered Brussels sprouts spicy pine nut pizza. It was unique and extremely tasty. If the service would have been better I would have given 5 stars. All in all it is good place which serves great food prepared from local ingredients.

Terrible service, okay food. I wasn't seated until 40 minutes past my reservation time. That was already really upsetting and the food took too long to arrive. Portions were quite small and the only redeeming dishes were the pizzas, which were good but not wait-40-minutes-past-your-res-time-looking-awkward-by-the-bar good. Friend got the MP lobster, which was a really sad dish of just a poorly overcooked lobster chopped in half. I had really high expectations for this restaurant but it really, really sucked. The ambiance was beautiful and the decor was tasteful too, it just wasn't worth the time that we waited, and we weren't even full after the meal. I want to give this place the benefit of the doubt and say that we ordered the wrong dishes, but they were just too mediocre. Will not be coming back.

Returned like six years later for dinner and had a great meal. Feels super pricey now, but it definitely holds up. I tried:+ Mission fig colada + Pineapple milk punch - both drinks were great+ Peekytoe crab toast - highlight #1+ Yellowfin tuna crudo - letdown, super peppery + Kale salad - little too vinegary + Chestnut gigli pasta - great + Steamed Black Sea bass - highlight #2+ Market plum and pear crisp - highlight #3+ Chocolate layer cake Overall ABC is still a fantastic choice, just be prepared to spend big time.
Everything we ordered was really good. The mushrooms pizza and the duck main dish especially stood out.

The ambience is great, I also love how all the abc restaurants are within one building but they all have different vibes and theme. Between my friend and I we shared the ravioli, broccolini and the basil, tomato pizza. 10/10 recommend. Also dessert is a must here.

This was definitely a 3.5. We got a reservation for three on a Saturday night. By the time we decided to eat here, they only had reservations at the cocktail table. It was a nice unevenly shaped tall table with three high chairs with no back support. This was fine with me but I was shocked that there were no hooks or at least a place to put/hang bags and jackets.The cocktails were ok for the price of 17-19 dollars. We shared the heirloom tomato toast which was delicious. Our waitress really didn't know the menu well bc she said it would be cut perfectly into three pieces but it came out in four. I got the honey roasted duck. It was good except there was too much of the strong white sauce which overpowered the rest of the meal. The cheeseburger and fries were good. What was disappointing was the fried chicken! My friend does not like Swiss chard. The waitress reassured her that there was barely any Swiss chard in the dish and that it was only used in the sauce. I was skeptical as the menu literally says fried chicken and Swiss chard.... The waitress was soooo wrong. If my friend had known, she would've gotten another dish or asked for the Swiss chard to be replaced. Also, the Swiss chard had a very strong rose flavored taste which was overwhelmingly bad. It was like eating perfume.It would've been a four if not for the really disappointing fried chicken dish.

What a fancy restaurant! I loved the restaurant's decor style of white oak, wooden accents, and antique pieces with branches and ambient lighting. On a normal day, I wouldn't approach ABC Kitchen due to it being on the higher end of pricing - but fortunately for me, I was able to try this place out with my colleagues! The restaurant was pretty spacious and was able to accomdoate our party of 9. The waitstaff were very accomodating and checked up on us plenty of times to make sure we were okay. Our food took around ~1.5 hours to arrive, which was longer than we would've liked. I ordered a coconut water, pizza w/ basil, mozzarella, and tomato sauce, and fries. The dough of my pizza was burnt, and the sauce/cheese did not hold on well to the dough because it kept slipping off whenever I grabbed a slice. For the price, I would hope the structural integrity would be better. The fries were a delight and great appetizer to share with everyone. All in all, it was a nice place to dine at. Food was okay, but don't come if you only have an hour for lunch!

Great ambiance with delicious and unique dishes! I came up with a group of friends for dinner and the ambiance was great for a friends catch up. I got the crab toast and Black Truffle, Fontina, and Farm Egg Pizza to share with my boyfriend. Â Both dishes were absolutely delicious and unique. The crab toast was really fresh and the squeeze of lemon juice on top really adds to it. I love the truffle and the egg mix on the pizza. It was honestly a great combo and a tasty pizza. Can't wait to come back and try the other unique dishes they have!

Every time you visit ABC Kitchen, you can be sure that you will have a great experience. The restaurant features a changing menu, to feature seasonal vegetable dishes, while also maintaining favorites.We kicked off the night with the Roasted Carrot and Avocado salad... 1 word: Amazing! I am not necessarily the biggest fan of carrots, but this dish is sweet and savory and everything you could want in a salad.Next is the Fluke Tartare. I did not expect much from this dish as ABC Kitchen is usually more focused on locally sourced veggies, but it was definitely tasty. Also the chips - they are so light and crispy I don't even know.We also ordered the calamari. This is very different than fried calamari I've gotten at other places. ABC Kitchen's chef fries them to perfection with a sweet/salty crust. Hence... the pretzel taste.Our last starter was the Black Truffle Stracciatella. This was liquid gold. I have nothing else to say.Any pizza you get is honestly delicious. I don't have anything bad to say about them. The crust: yum! The toppings: yum!The Habanero Fried Chicken is a refreshing and elevated take on fried chicken. The crispiness is light and fluffy, and the spice is at just the right level. ABC Kitchen outdoes itself with that one. I order this dish with a side of mashed potatoes and it is honestly one of the best I have ever had.The duck is seasonal, and so popular that it is sometimes sold out when we go!! Absolutely delicious. I don't usually love duck but this was so good.The Ricotta Ravioli... I am not usually a fan of ravioli, funnily enough, but this dish is so tasty. I know this review may seem like an ode to ABC Kitchen, but honestly, everything I have tried here was a 10/10.For desserts... The chocolate cake is absolutely amazing. I don't know what type of chocolate crunch they put on there but it made the whole cake so much better. And the toasted marshmallows?? I mean... yum!Finally... You CANNOT skip this Caramel Sundae. It has everything you could love. Hot chocolate fudge, crispy caramel popcorn and delicious ice cream. What more can I say?

Had a great dining a while ago. Just need to catch up with all my reviews. Food is delicious and it's better to take your date here rather dining aloneI had their salad and beef tartar. Both are great.

What a gem! Beautiful interior and a great spot for a date or catching up with some friends. The interior is very spacious and wonderfully decorated. Ordered the crab toast, black truffle pizza, and ricotta ravioli. Crab toast: 10/10 - the flavors melt in your mouth and the dish tastes even better with the lemon squeezed on top. The rest of the reviews aren't exaggerating how great this dish is. Black truffle pizza: 10/10 - I love anything with truffle but the thin crust and egg really made this pizza standout to me. I crave it!Ricotta Ravioli: 5/10 - it doesn't taste bad by any means but is just very normal and I could have eaten this anywhere else/even made it at home 4/5 stars for the very slow service

Came here for a business dinner and had a great time. I would absolutely recommend this for a group, or even just for a date night out!The ambiance is pretty cool in the restaurant, with distinct white furniture illuminated by great mood lighting. The high ceilings with exposed beams really added to the ambiance too.Our server was extremely helpful with recommendations, as we ended up ordering a bunch of wine and shared appetizers. We ordered the peekytoe crab toast, Long Island fluke tartare, and kale salad to share. All of the ingredients were fresh and flavors complex. In particular, I loved the crab toast with buttery bread and fresh crab! For my entree, I enjoyed the duck breast, which was beautifully prepared and well proportioned. I usually never order duck but felt inspired by the mushroom dashi. It lended a great umami to the dish. I would definitely come back.

Wow ... good food .. however we just sat and waited 2 hours from the time of ordering and receiving our food ... at a time when the restaurant was not overcrowded .... there really was no reason for the painful delay nor should the customer have to figure out what was the cause of delay. The front line service people offered several apologies ... when it was time to pay and add the tip .. Â and it really wasn't their fault .... but absolutely terrible service from a restaurant that charges premium prices and represents themselves as an upper tier restaurant. I felt like I was at Friendly's. A terrible experience that left all of us feeling ripped off.
Food was delicious, everyone loved what they ordered and the space is beautiful - calm and intimate with a slight chic but not too minimalist interior.
A very nice and fancy restaurant with a great atmosphere. The aesthetic was perfect for a date.

Date night before a Rangers game was here. I didn't have all the much to eat all day so I was a bit famished. We got the following:Crab toast: delicious! My date let me have 3/4 pieces (so romantic). It is a very simple dish where lumps of crab meat are placed on top of toasty bread with some aioli or sauce that you squeeze lemon on top. My date and I both think it is not necessary to put much work in a dish if you're using simple ingredients. I really loved this dish. Sort of craving it now... *****Sea bass: the show stopper of this dish is the yellow chunks on top that are actually compoted lemon rinds. It was cooked in a way that had a cooked potato texture. I had to have my date try it so I put a bit of everything on a spoon and he agreed. ****Kale salad: this was good for what it was, but I just dont like kale in general so my date finished this dish while I worked on the crab toast **Pear mylk punch: it tasted like Xmas morning, but I was not all that a fan of super sweet drinks. Overall, the drinks here is just okay for me. It was hard to find a cocktail that met up to my standards, but they did give me a buzz. I eventually got a gin based drink that I asked to replace with their vodka lemonade and it was like a fancier mimosa. It was okay, but just like a mimosa, they are very filling. I've had brunch here before by myself and I liked it then too. I was blown away by the first dish because of the crÃ¨me fraise moment they had there. However, think this place was a bit more special and romantic last night because of my sweet date! Perfect romantic date night spot in my opinion! Also, can't really go wrong with Jean George!

*** 3.5 stars ***A bit loud, and the tables a bit close together, ABC Kitchen is still a very beautiful upscale spot that would be good to take someone that you are trying to impress. I really liked it here, but I did find the food to be a bit salty (yellowfin tuna crudo, fresh chili oil, crushed fennel seed & steamed black sea bass, roasted mushrooms and asparagus ginger-scallion condiment basil and lime). Don't get me wrong, everything was beautiful and the experience was wonderful, I just found the food to be lacking (definitely not bad, just not great) to live up to the ambiance.

Abc kitchen is great casual dinner date and the cocktails are sooo good. The restaurant is much larger in the inside than it looks on the outside. Very spacious and the tables are a good distance from each other.The waiter was incredible nice and gave really good recommendations. All the cocktails were delicious and we had to get a couple rounds to try them all. My favorites were the pear milk punch which sounds really weird but tastes very good. The smoke fig sour was yum as well. The waiter suggested we get the roast carrot and avocado and I was hesitant at first because it sounded plain but it actually really delicious. It's more savory than it sounds. The crab toast was good but nothing out of the world. My favorite dish was the black truffle pizza. It was SO good. We ended up ordering a second after finishing the first. It's a must of you go.

I enjoyed my meal at ABC kitchen, despite it not being my usual type of meal. Everything tasted fresh and clean, with unique flavors.If you are eating here, make sure to get the chocolate cake with malt ganache & toasted marshmallow meringue. It is truly special, with various textures.
Amazing vibes & food. We got the crab toast for an app & I got the sword fish for my meal. So yummy!

My review is actually like 4.5 stars. I wish I could give it 5 stars but we were freezing all night. There's no insulation in the building and we even moved our seats but staff did little to help us get warm. So I ordered tea lol. It was also half empty so maybe they rely on it being full to be warmer? Food was excellent as expected. Everything was beautiful and filled with fresh fruits and vegetables. The crab toast was delicious as expected and so was the sashimi. My favorite was the citrus salad which contained pretty much all of the citrus fruits imaginable! For our mains I got the fried chicken which I never do but it was quite light and lovely with the habanero sauce. My friend got the sea bass which was cooked to perfection and had a very rich soothing broth. We both ordered panna cotta for dessert but was already too full to enjoy the cranberries and biscuits (?) that come with it. I also got the ginger lime soda--yum!I'll definitely be back but wearing a thick sweater and layers next time!

We had weekend brunch here recently. This is a busy and noisy place, but with a lively and fun feel. We got seated right away for our reservation.The breakfast potatoes in particular were really tasty--much better than an average side dish at brunch. My friend's crab toast was a nice portion with a lot of crab. The dutch baby was tasty and a different take on breakfast food.Everything tasted great! The service was just a bit spotty. One of our entrees did not come out right away, and it took a while to get our server's attention to get this corrected. Otherwise, we enjoyed our experience and would return.

I was there for a business lunch and I'm surprised that this restaurant has so many good reviews. To be fair, the restaurant has an amazing ambiance but it's very loud and the food is mediocre at best (and way overpriced for the quality of the food). I had crab toast (meh), sea bass (very disappointing, overcooked and way too salty), cappuccino (passable) and peach shortcake (original but just passable and way too sweet for a dessert that the waitress claimed to be a refreshing summer dessert). TLDR; worth visiting once but not a good restaurant with so many amazing options right around the corner.

I had Saturday brunch at ABC Kitchen in a party of 5. We made a reservation so we didn't have to worry about waiting and were seated pretty quickly. There were a lot of interesting menu items so we ordered a bunch of different things for the table.Mushroom pizza - the flavor was okay, it was pretty oily so the crust got pretty soggy and all the toppings kind of fell off.Pistachio babka - really fragrant, highly recommend!Dutch pancakes - also really good with a custard-like texture Chicory salad - I got this cause of the figs but I would probably skip it next timeFrench fries/bacon - both fine, kind of what you would expectI really liked the ambience at ABC Kitchen and would really recommend it for a nice brunch in the city!!

This review is for brunch only. Had a 1:30pm reservation on a Saturday and the restaurant wasn't too full. The restaurant itself is beautiful. Love the decor and the ambiance - this is a perfect place for a cute friend brunch. Service was fine as well. The food was pretty good. Nothing I would necessarily crave or go out of my way to come back for, but it was tasty enough, that the food on top of the ambiance would bring me back again. The menu on their website is a little different than what they actual serve FYI (eg: online has blueberry babka, but it wasn't on their actual menu) - this was disappointing. They also were sold out of the doughnuts which was disappointing. I ordered:-Baked Eggs: this was pretty good and surprisingly filling. Downside, I thought they were stingy with most of the toppings (bacon and sweet potatoes). It also had sliced jalapeÃ±os on top which the menu didn't list and I took off. -Peekytoe Crab Toast: this was good!-Side of Fries: these were good! Some crispy, some not but very good. -Spinach Goat Cheese Pizza: friend ordered this and she enjoyed. They definitely don't hold back on the spinach (it comes with A LOT). She said the pizza has kick to it - Â they put red chili flakes on it.

My friend made a reservation for brunch this past Saturday and we were seated right away. I ordered the soft boiled eggs, which comes with a side of toasted sourdough bread and she ordered the carrot and avocado salad with a side of chicken. We shared the crispy potatoes with garlic aioli. I really liked my dish - it was very refreshing and reminded me of a fancy deconstructed egg salad. My friend really enjoyed her salad dish and although salads typically aren't too filling, this one was filling enough that she had leftovers. We both enjoyed the potatoes - they were super crispy and well seasoned and the garlic aioli paired perfectly. The restaurant is decorated very nicely and has a really nice atmosphere. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to others!
Good food and atmosphere. Great service and friendly. Accommodating. Very busy and noisy. But we could hear each other across the table. Not sure how that worked? I'd go back.

Phenomenal food! I would recommend the duck and crab toast. They also have a great variety of drinks, there is something for everyone. It has a beautiful atmosphere and would be great for any occasion. Can't wait to go back!

The food here is phenomenal! I got the margherita pizza. Our party ordered duck , fried chicken, fries, and the brown butter cake. Â Sooo good! The fries are to die for. The waiters and waitresses are nice and helpful. They took my coconut water when I had a sip left but was gone before i could say anything lol. My only suggestion would be to ask if they can take your food away first but it's ok, really great experience here!

The food and drinks here were great! I tried most of the appetizers, the black truffle pizza, the scallops, and the Sea Bass. Although each scoop I had was great, I was dying to reorder the Peekytoe Crab Toast and the Long Island Fluke Tartare. There was a sweetness to the crab toast that gave it sweet and savory taste and made me request another round for the table mid-way through the meal. The tartar was also delicious but instead of sweetness, the standout flavor in this dish some tangy citrus. For drinks, I mostly stayed with wine but I do recommend the ginger margarita. Overall, I would return here in a heartbeat and I hope the crab toast is still on the menu .

I went to abc kitchen for my bday with 3 friends on a Sunday night 7pm. The restaurant was pretty quite. We were able to Â enjoy a nice quite dinner with great ambiance. The hostess was very friendly. I sat at the bar while waiting for my friends, great service!For dinner, we got the sea bass, ricotta ravioli and the fried chicken: Sea bass 2.5/5Ricotta ravioli 3/5Fried chicken 3.5/5Chocolate cake 6/5Appetizer: Crab toast 5/5Calamari 4/5The decor was very beautiful but food needs improvement

We had a group of about 10 people and honestly had some of the slowest service I have ever had in New York. Â At this price point they need to be on it and not only did they take over 15 minutes to take our drink order, they also brought our first round of drinks after our mains arrived.... Food was ok but again I would say at this price point the service needs to greatly improve and I would expect a little more on the food quality as well.

My team hosted a small dinner here, and everything was perfect. The table setting, the servers, the attention to detail, and ofcourse food. We had a pre fixed sort of menu that included some amazing salads, chicken/fish for the main course, followed by a delicious dessert. We were sitting in a corner with very nice table setting and it wasnt too loud. Highly recommend for celebrations and group events.

column2: Downtown Jersey City, Jersey City, NJ
column5: I went to ABC Kitchen for brunch on a Saturday. It wasn't too crowded, but was fairly busy by the time I left. The ambience of the restaurant is excellent. Tables are spacious and each table is distanced generously from other tables. Lighting and atmosphere are also good. The staff is courteous and attentive. We tried three dishes. The first dish we tried was the crab toast. It was crab served on crunchy toast with a lemon to squeeze on it. It was an excellent dish and I would order it again. We also had the strawberry compote with bread. The compote is served with some ricotta cheese as well to form a less viscous jam when mixed with the strawberry compte. The strawberry compote was flavorful, but I would probably pass on it if I came to ABC kitchen again for brunch. Finally, we had the Dutch pancake. I had never had a Dutch pancake before, so I didn't know what to expect. It was incredibly fluffy and tasty when combined with the provided lemon and syrup.I'm very curious to try ABC kitchen again for their other dishes. Among the places I have visited in NYC so far, I would definitely put ABC kitchen among the best that I have experienced so far.

Two words - crab toast. This is simply one of the best dishes that I've ever had, and something that will keep me returning to ABC Kitchen for as long as they offer it. The rest of the menu is great too - it's seasonal and highlights the freshest of ingredients - same with their cocktail list which is always evolving (the vodka thyme lemonade is one of my all time favorites). Â I typically make a reservation, but sometimes they can squeeze in walk ins. It's also conveniently located in ABC Home so you can shop while you wait!

As a Jean Georges restaurant, expectations were understandably high and ABC Kitchen did not disappoint! Ambiance was great, service was excellent and the food was even better!Truffle Pizza: Neither of us is a big fan of fried eggs, so we opted to leave off the cracked egg topping the pizza. The size was perfect for 2-3 people to share as a starter and the flavors were excellent. My only wish was that NYC pizzerias served it in the standard size so i could have boxes delivered to my apartment on a weekly basis. Sea Bass: By far my favorite item. It was so flavorful and fresh. The preserved lemons and pairing with baby potatoes and spinach complimented the natural flavors. It was also cooked to perfection with a wonderful flaky flesh and crispy seared crust. Fried Chicken: While I was really into the aesthetics and the unique take on fried chicken, the puffy crunch crust was the best part of the chicken. the meat itself was a little fatty and I felt it needed a bit more seasoning. The sauce underneath complimented the plainness of the chicken, but the blanched greens had no seasoning at all (including salt).For dessert we ordered the chocolate cake, panna cotta, and were surprised with a mini caramel popcorn sundae as a complimentary birthday treat. This was very sweet of the staff. All desserts were good, but did not match the creativity and the flavors of the dinner dishes. We also ordered wine and the citrus and sage cocktail which paired great with the light flavors of the food. Overall, the restaurant was fabulous and did a great job of maintaining safety standards and quality service. Will certainly be back for a restaurant week or other special occasion.

My friend made a reservation for 2pm on a Saturday and the place was packed! We were starving and ordered the Crawford cheddar biscuits, peekytoe crab toast, truffle pizza, and their cardamom Dutch baby pancake. We also got the lemon thyme mocktail which was refreshing with a light lingering taste of thyme which paired well with all of our savory dishes. The biscuits were flaky and buttery balls of perfection and their peekytoe crab toast had a generous amount of fresh crab. The star of the show was their truffle pizza with a farm egg on top. It was large enough to share with the perfect amount of truffle oil and cheese. The only disappointing part of the meal was the cardamom Dutch baby pancake. It was a little burnt and was slightly bitter. They also used quite a large amount of cardamom which also left quite an unpleasant taste in our mouths. They were kind enough to comp us the pancake since we couldn't eat it at all. This is a great place for brunch and drinks! Check out my foodsta @chiuventure for a closer look and more details of my dining experience here as well as other establishments in NYC and around the world!
Delish food and drink. mostly amazing service from all staff. VERY LOUD and dimly lit. (dined 7/19/22, 2pple)

It took us a while to find the restaurant because of a tiny sign. The food here was mediocre but enjoyed the candlelight, pretty flowers atmosphere. We were told by our waiter that the restaurant does not offer complimentary birthday dessert. we would have to order desserts and he will put a birthday candle on top.

Service is great and the atmosphere is nice. Â Everything about the food is really good EXCEPT the salt content. Â Too much salt in almost everything! Â Beautiful lobster roll with too much salt sprinkled on top. Â Fries and chips with way too much salt. Pizza is too salty. Â They should call this place ABC Salt.

Summary: solid food. We came here because we are Jean Georges/Nougatine fanatics and wanted to see if we could taste his handprint hereTaste: the food was awesome. Compared to a typical restaurant that looks like this or serves similar menu items this place is clearly distinguished. I would say nougatine is still a tier above, but you can tell this is jg's handiwork as the flavor profiles are nuanced 1. Pretzel crusted calamari: calamari heaven. We sat down hungry and this hit the spot. The sauce that it comes with is amazing. The serving size is good for two people 2. Fluke tartare: also very good tartare - light and refreshing but also flavorful. Portion is a bit light so suitable for just a single person or at most two 3. Black Sea bass: good; nice and light but still flavorful. Served in a translucent broth that seems to be chicken based and added with yuzu. The overall portion is on the smaller side so if you're looking for comfort food then I'd recommend the burger 4. Burger: this is in the top 2-3 burgers I've had in New York. The patty was very juicy and tender, and the vinaigrette dressing on the lettuce cut through the fat and cheese very well. A filling portion for sure. The fries were also cooked nicely Drinks: cocktails here were AMAZING. Do not skip this!1. Rhubarb milk punch: I always order milk punch whenever I see it on a cocktail menu. For those who don't know what milk punch is, it's brandy or rum aged with milk and clarified with certain ingredients to remove the more harsh tastes from the alcohol. The result is an extremely smooth and sweet drink with clear color2. Â Mezcalita: this was probably my favorite. Just a very well executed mezcalita; easy to drink3. Spring herb 75: this was really good too! Served in a champagne glass. Has a lot going on in terms of complex flavor profile but can be summarized as a sweet, fruity and slightly bubble drinkValue: on the pricier side but worth it. Our check for two people with the above came out to $190 after tax before tipAtmosphere: the main dining area is dimly lit with candles - honestly a really cool experience. This restaurant is actually connected to a bougie furniture store and has this unique rustic aesthetic Frequency: will definitely be back for the calamari, burger, and cocktails. I can see myself coming back once every 2-3 months

The peeky toe crab & almost all of their desserts are phenomenal. However when I was there last month I ordered the duck breast & it came out extremely undercooked (almost raw). I didn't realize this in the low lighting, but shortly after taking the first bite I completely lost my appetite. They did afterwards bring me out a plate of the duck that was properly prepared but of course my whole family had already finished eating by the time this was done & after the feeling & taste of raw duck in my mouth I no longer was hungry.

Pretty disappointed by this place. The service was sorely lacking. We came here for brunch and ordered the calamari, the crab toast, and the lobster. It took more than 10 minutes after sitting for our server to come and give us our menus. The service was very perfunctory, they didn't check on us at all except to refill our drinks occasionally. The worst part is that I've been having health issues. One of the side effects is hair loss AKA shedding. The server was noticeably grossed out as they were clearing the table and saw a few of my stray hairs on the plates. It may be not super fun but I don't think it was okay for them to say, "ew, a hair" aloud. It was clearly my hair and I apologized for it but I didn't feel great about it. They also did not respond to my apology which made me feel worse.The food was mediocre - the crab toast was pretty fishy and the calamari wasn't evenly breaded. The lobster was fine but not worth it at the market price. It was not especially unique. I would not recommend this place.

OK so the service just happened to be terrible this time but it is usually pretty good. However the Seabass was consistently bad. Overall a great place to eat if you want to do small plates and tapa style with a group but I do not recommend any of the Entrees. Overall it is fairly anti-inflammatory and relatively healthy with good taste. A good place to break your fast in Ramadan and the music is always 80s vibes

Good food plan to return. The fried chicken, pasta, and duck (though a small portion according to my dining friend) were all yummy. The apple Ala mode and chocolate cake were fab. My one critique was the supetbdim lighting really Â made reading the menu and seeing the food hatd.

Nice ambiance, tasty drinks, and great desserts! That green juice cocktail was amazing. Felt healthy! Haha. The desserts were great. Tasty, but not overly sweet. Just a right balance. Would come back again.

I came here with a group of 5! The tables are very long and makes it easy to eat comfortably with the amount of space available. The atmosphere is very candle lit date night vibes. Our service was top notch! However, the food was pretty mediocre. But I will say the crab toast was my favorite!
Great food, especially the crab toast. There was also a fish dish that came in some broth that was excellent but I don't remember the name. Can't wait to go again.

Just stopped in for a late Sunday evening supper after cocktails nearby and ABC Kitchen did not disappoint. The crab toast was amazing as always. We also had some pizza, pasta and the ice cream sundae, it was all great.

Dropped by here for an after-date drink and sat at the bar. What intrigued me was the cool, yet welcoming vibe. I went at night so the lights were kinda dim Â (kinda hard to read the menu). Â The bartender was friendly and the dining room looked busy. Would come again to try the food. Bar seats were slightly uncomfortable, though. Â The place seemed a little one-note in terms of clientele, mainly millennial and gen x folks.

I came here for dinner with my cousins and had a lovely time. I think people come here for the ambience, dim lighting, string lights, floral arrangements, and long tables for larger parties. We ordered 2 pizzas (a spinach and goat cheese + a mushroom pizza), both which were pretty good. We also ordered ravioli, straciatella cheese which came with pita bread, and a kale salad. The portions are very small, so keep that in mind while ordering. We also ordered drinks which were quite tasty! While I won't say it was the best food I ever had, the experience was what made it a 4 star review in my mind. Staff was also very courteous!

We went as a group of 6 and tried over 10 dishes. 2/3rds of the dishes were so salty my throat felt parched. The prices are outrageous for the tiny amount of mediocre food you get. The only good thing was the decor and great service. Â Honestly shocking how busy it was on a Tuesday night...

Brunch was absolutely delish. It was really hard to choose between savory or sweet - there were three kinds of fresh-baked goodies and cardamon pancakes... and did I mention all the dessert, like the peach shortcake and milk chocolate layer cake? Coffee was weak but the crispy potatoes with aioli were addictive and I loved the egg sandwich with sumac hot sauce and fontina.

While I have eaten at ABC Kitchen many times, I had never been to brunch there until this last weekend. There were so many things I wanted to try and I changed my mind 100 times before deciding on the Dutch Baby and crispy bacon. The bacon came out very quickly, while understandably the Dutch Baby came out much later. It was delicious! The only problem with my meal is that it left me so full that I had no room left in my stomach and wasn't able to order my favorite sundae afterwards. Oh well...next time.

I wish I could give 4.5 stars! The only reason it wasn't a full 5 stars is because, for the price ($21), I was expecting a much more flavorful hollandaise sauce on my eggs Benedict. I did switch out the ham for sautÃ©ed spinach, so maybe with the ham it would have been better. The blueberry babka bun and the baked eggs were absolutely delicious! And the chocolate layer cake and the peach tarte tatin were also excellent. Often chocolate layer cakes taste like ganache on Betty Crocker cakes, but the sponge itself had amazing flavor. I came out very full and very happy :) For the cocktails, we had the ginger margarita and the Paloma, which were good, but the salting of the rims was a little aggressive. I was also very happy to be introduced to Banyuls dessert wine which I cannot wait to buy a bottle of!

I've always liked this place and continue to think it's a good spot for food. Â However, today's visit was a bit disappointing on the service side .... primarily because of the very long wait between appetizers and entree. Â They did explain they had a very large party on the top floor and they were really busy in the restaurant as well. Â We were a big party of 10+ so maybe it was just to much for them to accommodate. Â Getting back in the swing of things after Covid may not be an easy thing.What I've had ...Yellow Fin Tuna Crudo ... very fresh fish with a tangy sauce. Â Would have liked a preparation where the fish would've had time to absorb more of the flavors of the sauce, but it was good.Peekytoe Crab Toast ... amazing dish with lots of flavor and a sauce that is not overly creamy so you can still get the freshness of the crab. Â Black Sea Bass with Chilies and Herbs ... the fish was good although a bit bland, but the bed of wild mushrooms it was served over was SPECTACULAR Â I'm a huge fan of mushrooms so this may be tipping the balance for me, but it was such a good side of vegetables.Service in general is good. Â As mentioned before, the main issue was just the backlog and delays they were having in the kitchen. Â One thing that was a bit strange is that even after the long wait no apologies for the very long delay or any type of "gesture" to make up for the inconvenience. Â They're usually good so something was definitely off today.Ambiance ... really elegantly casual. Â Great setting for large parties because of all the space they have. Â It's one of those out of the norm NYC restaurants where you're not crowded with other diners and it's a nice ample dining room. Â Open kitchen which I always like as it really adds to the experience. Hence, overall my review is OK. Â I do hope they get their mojo back for lunch services as this has always been a go to place.

This is such a solid go to restaurant for lunch or dinner. DRINKS Sparkling Citrus and SageCitron infused gin, blood orange, lime and sage $18Vodka Thyme Lemonade $16Grainger vodka, thyme, lemonPear swizzle $16Street pumas rum, Hamilton Demerara rum, market pear pineapple, orange
One of my favorite restaurants in NYC a must try beautiful establishment and food was a ten try the cornbread dessert
The food was great - highly recommend the mushroom pizza. Very cool ambiance for an elegant yet casual dinner

Having grown up in California, this place is somewhat amusing to experience. Â The best way that I can describe it is an elevated Sweetgreen. Â Think paltry portions, overpriced, oversold on freshness and seasonality and organic and whole-wheat (and insert more trendy diet-related adjectives of choice that California's health/wellness/fitness industry popularized), and ultimately unsatisfying if not dissatisfying. Â I got two appetizers and am glad I didn't get more though the portion size are, in Sweetgreen-fashion, paltry. Â You can really only get away with such small portions when the ingredients and execution are top-notch and neither happened here. Â The tuna crudo was not that fresh, poorly sliced, strangely over-salted, and lacked any level of umami though it was swimming in chili oil. Â The housemade stracciatella was not bad, only because I always love a good fresh cheese, but you pay $24 for a generally good fresh cheese with some seeds and micro greens on top served with normal wheat pita bread. Â Frankly, I could've put together both myself after a Wegman's trip. Â That said, though, the Reviver cocktail is pretty good. Â Fresh, complex, herbaceous, and earthy all at once. Â If you're here for good drinks and are okay snacking on overpriced Sweetgreen for pretended health reasons this place is for you. Â I also don't get the rickety, thin chairs diners are forced to sit on. Â Scandinavian flair as an excuse to save on costs, in my opinion.

Finally got a chance to dine here and couldn't complain. The staff (at least the ones I interacted with) were very warm and friendly. This place is def on the pricier side but its Â bc you're paying for the ambience more than anything. To start, we got the pretzel dusted calamari which was so crispy && def how calamari in other restaurants should be served. The mustard aioli that came with it was different for me but still tasty nonetheless. For our entree, our waitress recommended to us the fried organic chicken, the burger & the salmon (as her top 3 faves in that order). I went with the fried organic chicken which I thought wouldn't be be enough but It was. The chicken was cooked to perfection and very juicy. The batter was the right amount and added the perfect crunch. Now the butter on the plate seemed like a lot but It actually wasn't and I LOVE spice so the habanero was a nice kick. Think elevated chicken nugget with this dish. My friend got the salmon which she also enjoyed -- however it did have an overpowering cumin taste. For dessert we opted for the apple tart tatin which is basc like an apple pie but the apples are on top instead of inside. I'm not a dessert fan but I enjoyed this a lot. Overall the place was nice to dine in and is def a nice date spot. I'll def be back to try other items on the menu like that burger.
Love love love coming here. I come here often for lunch and dinner.The drinks the food. Everything is soo FRESH. It is absolutely magical.See you soon ABC Kitchen

This was my first time at ABC kitchen for date night with a friend. We started with drinks, a sparkling strawberry cocktail and rhubarb lavender fizz. Both were good and refreshing. Price range for cocktails anywhere from $16-$20. For appetizer I chose the peekytoe crab toast and my friend decided on the kale salad with asparagus. The toast was absolutely divine. The bread was toasted well with crab and a few drops of butter on top. After adding a squeeze of lemon onto the crab which was the perfect amount of zest, I devoured and savored every bite. For entree my friend chose the steamed Black Sea bass with roasted mushroom, asparagus, and a ginger-scallion condiment. I had my eye set on the grilled faroe island salmon with Yukon gold potato salad, grilled ramps, and green chili. The green chili was a bit intense in flavor but when you take a piece of the salmon, ramps and potato together it compliments each other well. The size of entree is a decent portion for one person with a price range of $28-$40. However, if you've come with an appetite I would suggest going for an appetizer to start. Of course my favorite part of the night was dessert. We chose the cookie plate and one scoop of the white coffee stracciatella , caramel, and smoked vanilla ice cream. The cookie plate consisted of cherry blossom sable, mint chocolate crinkle, lemon lavender macaron, snickerdoodle, and brown butter chocolate chip. I would give a 6/10 due to my personal preference of cookies. The brown butter was a little salty for me and I did not enjoy the inside of the snickerdoodle which tasted like it may have had a touch of matcha. However, the lavender macaron tasted light and perfect in flavor. I am not sure whose hands blessed the ice cream cream combination but it was the best ice cream I have had in a while. It was hard to not lick the plate in a public setting. Lol The only critique I would offer would be for customer service. Before we could take off our coats to sit the waiter came over and began to do a run down of the menu. I would have preferred to be settled in first. Finally, when we were ready to pay we waited about 20 mins for the waiter to come over. So long in fact that another person graciously took care of it for us instead. During our dinner we were asked how everything was with our dishes and I always appreciate that in a new restaurant I try. It is very busy in ABC so I can understand that it is difficult to attend to everyone in a timely fashion so I will certainly give grace on that end. Overall I enjoyed my experience at ABC kitchen.
So so so good! I have a wonderful meal at ABC. I can still taste it. I highly recommend this NYC spot. I only wish I had come here sooner. Don't hesitate to go for brunch.

I've been wanting to try this place out for a while, partially cause I saw a photo of its crab toast ahah! We came here one Friday night and got the crab toast, fries, and two pizzas (along with some beverages). I ordered the black truffle pizza and I think that was the highlight of the meal! The crust was thin and oozing with cheese and the egg! The only one thing was that I thought it was too oily for my liking but great flavor!

Ive been here several times both pre and post covid (wait are we even considered post covid yet). It's a great date spot with decent food.I always get the peekytoe crab toast. Their pizzas/flatbreads are also good.Since the pandemic they have merged their menus across the three restaurants (kitchen, Cocina, and abcV) so we got to try dishes from each place, which was quite cool. From their vegan restaurant, I would recommend the hummus! It comes with crudite and everything tastes so fresh and wonderful.

Having been a regular patron at this place, i used to have very high regards. Â ABC used to have impeccable quality of food and service - a standard that I used tell other should match. Â However, lately both the service and quality of food has gone down. Â The veggie burger with pita bread today was very disappointing. Â The pita bread seemed like it was grilled in a bed of oil. Â I still have the oil after taste. Â The service has also gone down. Â We we're served the main course followed by starters followed by bread for the table. Â Did not expect the service to go down with a change in managers.

love this place and food. However, I was disappointed to find out they were out of the topping we had ordered after eating and asking them. They kindly said well that we shouldn't pay for the topping without asking our preference of choice.

I was really excited to try this place after hearing so many good things about it especially dessert. The restaurant is really beautiful. Started off with crudo & traditional pizza- in my opinion best things I ate all night. For mains- burger; if I remember correctly it has a taziki sauce which completely throws off the burger. Other Main which must have been seasonal was some kind of stew- really not memorable. Dessert was just ok. We got the caramel popcorn sundae and the chocolate layer cake. I was really excited for dessert so this was a big disappointment. I wasn't crazy about any of the drinks we ordered and they were on the higher price side. Overall I thought this restaurant was just ok. I probably won't return. Service was ok. In my opinion slightly overpriced especially the drinks. With an average cocktail price of $18- in my opinion drinks should be elevated and spot on. That was definitely not the case here.

I used to really like this place before covid. Came last night for thanksgiving 3 course prix fixe for $128. The service was so disorganized with multiple servers serving our table. Our main server was soooo bad I was about to walk out at one point. He literally ordered something for me without even talking to me about it and later claimed I wanted that.... -_-. Â Another server fixed it for me after my friend complained. Two different servers also tried to bring me other peoples wine and food, twice! Not to forget my server literally just ordered something for me without my permission! Will never be back again. Thanks but no thanks. Disappointing for $128 for 3 course! My scallop crudo was subpar with such bad sauce mixture. My lobster was cooked well but the sauce made it strange tasting. The dessert was just so so. Â Overall Def not worth $128 esp with such irritating and poor service.

First visit to this long established place. It was good, if not a bit routine. Fried chicken was moist and large portioned and the side of mashed potatoes typically of comfort. Tuna ceviche appetizer was also good. A restaurant to return to for a satisfying meal but not one for an excellent meal of surprise and uplift.

Not very good. The food was quite bland and for the prices you will likely go home hungry. Service was also very poor, had to search for waitress all night to get drinks and water refilled. The drinks were also not very good. Had the Manhattan which was passable and an old fashioned that had crushed ice in? Interior is nice. Using the restroom is a fight with the door and the cramped room. Would recommend spending your 500 to 600 dollars for a party of 5 elsewhere.

Such a great spot! I've been obsessed with ABC Cocina for years, and really enjoyed my past visits to ABCV. I'm happy to say ABC Kitchen more than lived up to my expectation. The ambiance is cool, the staff is friendly, and the food and drinks were awesome. I highly recommend the scallops and peekytoe crab toast. The Long Island fluke tartare was much smaller than expected- good, but not as satisfying as the other two. For drinks: although the citrus and sage was too sweet for me, the bell pepper martini was wonderful. My husband also liked the Manhattan. Finally, the much-hyped chocolate cake was a very good chocolate cake, but the apple tarte tatin was the table favorite. This is a great spot for a date night or girls night out. Very classy and hip at the same time.

We decided to try this spot again after the debacle the first time and thought it was pretty good. The appetizers were amazing, we had the tar tar, calamari, and crab toast. I thought the crab toast and tar tar was best. For the entre, I had the sea bass which I thought was pretty good but not as good as the appetizers. Cocktails were interesting.

This place was fantastic! I dined at ABC V with a few colleagues and we all enjoyed pretty much everything on the menu. I am not a vegan or vegetarian but I did leave full and wanting to incorporate these meals into my lifestyle
Such a great vibe and lovely food and cocktails. It was quite warm in the middle of summer, but we didn't mind.
Standard brunch fare. We had the burger and salad. Solid and tasted well. Interior was really nice and so was the service.
Always a classic go-to for a special occasion or date night! As you can see, seafood options are delicious.

Loved my experience for brunch at ABC Kitchen. The inside was very trendy and the decor was cute. I got the cardamom dutch baby pancakes which were delicious. Had a very unique taste but very hearty for a breakfast. We also got some potatoes and bacon for the table and the bacon was crispy and divine. Loved my strawberry champagne too.

happy they are still going strong!had the jalapeno burger again, thanks old yelp review for reminding me what i liked! Â i think it tasted better this time.the spinach pizza was good too.good drinks.great service.

I always loved this place. Somehow it not quite up to par ... Friendliest staff, nice environment and reasonable prices but what happened to the service ? While quite pleasant the staff seem Inexperienced Coffee with no spoon to stir? Bread with no butter? Slightly Â cracked coffee mugs? No Splenda?  I also found the salmon plate very tough .. so much so that I needed a knife to cut the veins in it. The flavors are very nice but why use poor quality salmon ? I'll try again but some how I fear it may have lost that shabby chic specialness

Quality food, limited menu and not so many vegetarian options (although more than ABCV allegedly). I ordered the roast carrot and avocado salad for my main dish, while it was decent [4/5], it wasn't particularly exciting as a main meal and there weren't a lot of other vegetarian options on the larger side, other than a pasta.Service was woefully slow and not particularly friendly either. I'd give it another chance but I can't say it was as good as I was expecting.
Lovely place! The dessert peach shortcake was amazing, so was the sea bass and crudo! The roasted carrot salad was also very good! Lunch is not as busy, so I do recommend stopping by in the day ~

Went here for lunch with a friend and enjoyed lunch and the service! We were indecisive between lunch and dinner, so we had the pancake as well as the pizza and calamari. I also had a mimosa which was great.Vibe is very chill and nice. Would definitely recommend in the future.

ABC Kitchen, you're almost the perfect spot for me to dine with my non-vegan friends! The ambience is amazing, all of their restaurants are very Instagram-friendly. I came here with my sister for a nice dinner and was shocked to see that ABC Kitchen, part of a franchise that has a vegan restaurant (ABC V), didn't have anything "vegan" on their menu. You would think that they would understand that adding vegan options makes a really big difference to people who are vegan. It really surprised me. Luckily the waitress was super helpful but when restaurants don't offer a vegan option it usually leads to an unnecessarily painful experience. All three stars go to my waitress because she knew her stuff!Since they don't offer a vegan entrÃ©e I ordered more food than I would've liked, spending more money than I would've liked in result. I ended up getting a pizza with no cheese and a salad. The pizza was so thin and small - Â there was even a hole in the middle of the dough and it was hard to eat. It was delicious but, for the price, I was surprised. The salad was also super good but definitely not the same without cheese. Both of these options were supposed to have cheese on them which would make them more filling and adds some protein. There wasn't any vegan protein in my meal like a nut-based cheese substitute or chickpeas for the salad. These little details make a big difference to vegans. Our waitress was amazing - she was able to walk me though my options without having to ask. Sometime I can tell the staff doesn't know what vegan means and I'm nervous to get me food - I had zero stress. I also knew that if they messed up my food she would catch it. I wish I could give more stars but our meal was very pricey and I find it ridiculous that a franchise with a vegan restaurant doesn't even have the word "vegan" on their menu.

sad to say that this iconic restaurant has lost it. it had been one of my favorite nyc spots but no longer. save yourself time/money and go elsewhere.Here's why- service is now horrible - reduced menu- items out of kitchen lack consistency (one pizza was half the size of another one served to same table)- menu items are no longer executed to same standard as before and are a mere ghost of what they used to be so sad but i guess they are doing what they can

A classic New Yorker scene. Great food, healthy options, cocktails are divine, and ambience is always a high energy dining experience! Definitely recommend. Great for a corporate meal, date, or to take friends visiting from out of town. It's a very rustic farm to table vibe!

I came here for a brunch reservation with some friends. The ambience was nice and I enjoyed the food, but as another reviewer pointed out, I was a little disappointed by the lack of vegan options. Although I'm not vegan, I'm lactose and dairy intolerant. Also, I don't like salad, so I felt limited in my options (the pancakes, baked eggs, etc all contained dairy as a main component!). The waiter felt bad for me too when I mentioned this, but I made do with an oat latte, apple cider donuts, a side of bacon, and roasted potatoes. I also took some of my boyfriend's eggs benedict (but just a bit).It was all very good, but I do hope ABC Kitchen expands their menu in the future or trains their waiters on providing recommendations for those with dietary restrictions!

Lovely restaurant- once you get past the rude hostesses - (6/7/22 5.30pm). The 3 of them took absolutely ages to check in 2 young women that they knew - all smiles and laughing until they got to me. Anyways - the wait staff/servers were lovely, friendly and the food in divine - had a beautiful bottle of wine from their EXTENSIVE wine list. You would've got 5 stars had the hostesses been more welcoming.
The food was absolutely delicious and the ambiance was warm and inviting. I highly recommend.

Really good food, really conveniently located just off of union square. I really liked the feel of this place as well as it is exquisitely decorated. Didn't have any specific dish that was so stellar to recommend, and it was on the pricier side, but if you are in the area this is a solid choice.

I'm glad indoor dining has resumed in NYC, and I can enjoy the dinner without suffering from the chilly winter. The entrance of the restaurant is very low-key and easy to miss at night. I like the decor and ambience in the main dining room. The food were tasty, and the service was great. I was so full after the dinner. The only downside was the time limit on dining due to limited capacity during the pandemic. Would love to come back again after the pandemic.

Obsessed with ABC Kitchen and its part of Jean-Georges Restaurants! Love the ambiance and they also have a furniture /hardware store too! There's also two sister restaurants connected to ABC Kitchen which is ABC Cocina (mexican) and ABC V (vegan) which I eventually want to check out. Things I ordered:- Â Crab Toast (MUST GET!!)- Akaushi Cheeseburger- Â Ragu Pasta- Tuna Tartare

This review if for my lunch experience PRE-COVID19. My friends and I had reservations here (fortunately because there was a line even before they opened). We had a delightful lunch (pre-fixed menu which included appetizer, salad, main entree and dessert). Food was flavorful, I would say New American cuisine. Yes this spot is trendy and fun but I love it! The establishment is a bit pricey but well worth it. Amazing ambiance and the customer service was on point. Check out my pictures!

Winter restaurant week 2020 review.Came in for lunch on a Thursday with 7 coworkers. They gave us a great 8 top table in the corner. Â The space was buzzing and quite loud. Even in the corner, we strained to hear each other across the table. Wasn't a huge issue, but just a note if you plan to have any serious chats here. We were all planning to order from the restaurant week menu. We were given menus immediately, but it did take 10 minutes or so for the waiter to come back around, by that point we were definitely ready. From there it was smooth sailing. Apps came out quickly and entrees followed immediately after. We had a 1pm reservation and were out by 2:15 without feeling rushed. Perfect timing for lunch. Everyone loved the food - and the portions were very generous considering the price. The salmon salad was huge, well cooked large piece of fish and beautiful veggies which was surprising. I had the raw fluke (loved the fennel and citrus!) and the portobello sandwich (SO GOOD and spicy and crisp- maybe the best I've ever had).Overall everyone was impressed with food and service for such a low price. Definitely suggest visiting during restaurant week!

Great ambiance, but mediocre food and service. This place is a classic but too basic. We came here for dinner and was seated quickly. However, it took the servers a really long time to come and take our order. For two people, we got the peekytoe crab toast, gem lettuce, and mushroom whole wheat pizza to share. The crab toast was the only thing that tasted decent, but the crab quality could be better. We had to also wait quite a while before we got the gem lettuce and mushroom whole wheat pizza, which were both way too salty.
Do, good food, limited menu. However, service is horrible. Don't come on a Cridsy. They are too busy snd don't really care for you or your business. They seem to have plenty.

I had heard that they were doing outdoor dining in winter right and I was able to check it out last night and they are! Â The space feels opened yet covered and warm. The experience is unique because they are cooking out of all three kitchens and have selections from all menus. All the dishes we had were share-able and delicious. Timing of things were not exactly what I would expect normally but it's to be expected with a limited staff and three different kitchens and one bar. I would recommend this highly to any friends looking for a location near Union Square. And as expected the plates/glasses/cutlery was goals.

We arrived right at the time that we had reserved, but the hosts told us that we had to wait a while until the table before us finished dessert. We waited for quite a while, around 20 minutes possibly. That was slightly annoying, as I had booked the time and was hungry by then. Anyway, once we were seated, I was happy with the service, environment, and food for sure. The waitress was extremely helpful and attentive, while the dim cozy lighting made me extremely thankful for this meal I was having on Thanksgiving. We ordered dishes from the Thanksgiving set menu, and everything was beautifully put together. My favorite dish would have to be the squash toast appetizer with ricotta. I was completely blown away with how the different textures and flavors melted in my mouth, and I couldn't stop thinking about it the entire night. The meal was great and I had a great time finally checking out this place, which I've had on my list for a few years now!

Good food. Beautiful decor. Super loud. And comically bad service. Comical. As in- if you don't laugh you will cry!Had to flag down a server to order literally anything. At one point it took 30 minutes to get a glass of wine. Servers told us exactly nothing about the menu and what we were eating. By the way, none of the staff was rude or unkind at all, just inattentive and unresponsive. They also mentioned the bar was having a hard time.
Bad service. Sat down for half an hour, no water or waiter to help us order anything. Tables came in later than us got faster service. Would recommend avoiding this place

This was our first time back to ABC since the pandemic. I would like to start off saying that the bartender was very professional and kind, something is obviously going on in the kitchen. Â The bartender wasn't allowed to put our appetizer order in till we had the whole order. We ordered two apps and two entrees. Â The apps came out separately, didn't mind because we we're sharing. Placed the order at 7:50 PM. Finally got one entree ravioli at 9:00 PM which was ice cold. Â Kitchen sent out chicken entree at 9:15. The restaurant wasn't busy and there was plenty of staff. No excuse, entrees always come out the same time! This is restaurant 101. Why did the chicken take 1.25 hrs, that's crazy! I expect more from a place like this.
Among the most desired reservations in the city, this eatery is all the hype & then some of simply cooked perfection plus great decor; get it checked off bucket listOrig Post 11/12/15#dodrinkdine

Food was off the charts delicious! Â We had the kale Caesar salad, tuna crudo, sea bass, and popcorn ice cream sundae. Â Every dish was amazing, so clean, and so flavorful!!Ambiance was chic, understated, beautiful. Â  The server was great at making recommendations, patient with us, never rushed us. Â She was super nice and attentive.
Absolutely love this place from the ambiance, decor to service! If you are in New York, this is a must try place!

The ambiance was beautiful, lighting low but not impossible to see..very soft. Â Food was delicious we shared the Peekytoe Crab appetizer, and the entrees were fried chicken, scallops and sea bass. Â All perfect. Â Service was wonderful. Will definitely return. My only complaint was I wanted more food Â because it was so good.

Love this place!! The servers are very kind and my only real complaint was the uncomfortable chairs. We sat at a high top table with metal chairs and no backs. I don't really get for it being part of a furniture - couldn't we have more comfortable chairs and still be stylish? Anyway back to the food:Escarole - 4/5 very light and a nice touch from the artichokes and sweet nectarines, good clean appCrab toast - 5/5 okay I get why everyone raves about this. Seems simple but it's so lemony and savory and delicious!Sea bass - 3/5 it was good! But not anything special and still expensive. A little spicy but the citrus on top was too sour in my opinionBurger - 5/5 okay I get why everyone love this as well! There was something about the cheese and the pickled jalapenos didn't make it that spicy if you're worried about. Fries were perfectly crisp yext soft!

column2: Upper West Side, New York, NY
column5: If you are planning an event there beware! I used to love this place so when my parents opted to have my baby shower there I was elated. However, we were disappointed with the service. The food is amazing as always. However, we rented the room in the back for what is supposed to be a private event. It was not until 4 am the morning before that the manager informed us that the door to store ABC would open into our Â event room. Our private event became a public event people from the ABC store came wondering through our event. My guests were often interrupted by them asking them where the restroom was. We brought it up to general manager to please put a sign saying "private event" to keep off wanderers. However, she quickly dismissed us. The whole event was such a terrible experience despite them charging us a room fee to have the space to ourselves.

We tried to make the best of the situation, but at the end of the meal we were beyond disappointed.I'll start off positive by saying that the service was great - not an issue at all.The ambiance and food on the other hand were really lacking. We had dined here years ago and had a great experience, but this time our entrees were barely warm, very much bland in flavor, and the outdoor dining set up was lackluster in comparison to their sister restaurants.We even asked the party next to us, and although their food was better, they agreed that it didn't compare to past dining experiences.
I love their crab toast and caramel popcorn Sundae is one of my favorite desserts ever. Very cute decor and pleasant ambiance. Perfect for dates and weekend brunches.

Excellent server, food and drink Â was grt, fun and Â simple ambiance but need big improvement on desserts for real. Had chocolate cake ( which was so average, had better ones in cheaper price) and panna cotta was good but nothing special. Beside desserts everything else was excellent.

I came here for dinner recently and absolutely loved the place! The ambiance is incredible, the food was very good, and the service was the best part (shout out to our server Omar who was amazing - give that man a raise!) Highly recommend it.

We were able to snag a last minute reservation for Sunday (2/20) brunch. The decor is stunning, the food is divine, and most importantly, our server Allie, was a delight - professional, courteous, and full of personality. One word of advice - save room for the apple cider donuts!

Wow. Can't wait to go back. We had a fantastic casual Sunday brunch at ABC and it was one of the most enjoyable meals this summer. Server presentation, pace, taste, space, decor, price, lighting.. hard to describe, they just get it right and you know if you go. The place is enormous but maintains its charm and each section looks like you can get a different dining vibe all within the same restaurant. Menu is full of hits, makes you wish you went with more friends / want to book again to try some other dishes. We ordered 10 different things and it was all fresh, unique, balanced, delicious and well-portioned.ABC has the healthy-tasty food game figured out.

This review is long overdue. My friend who lives in NYC suggested we have lunch here and I'm SO glad we did! It's owned by Chef Jean Georges so I knew it was gonna be good! As soon as I stepped inside the dining room, I fell in love. My jaws dropped. What a BEAUTIFUL rustic chic space!! I absolutely LOVE LOVE LOVE the ambience and decor here!! Great place for a date or a girls night! The three of us shared the Crab Toast, Roasted Carrot & Avocado Salad and their Special that day which was a raviolo. All the food was delicious and beautiful. We enjoyed everything! Service was great! I seriously have zero complaints about this place. I wish they would open one in LA because I would go here all the time!

Came here with family and really enjoyed the experience. Â The service was attentive, but not annoying about it while being really nice. Â The cocktails were the highlight of the menu, but the food was also delicious. Â I ordered the hamburger with jalapeÃ±os and fries, which was really good. Â I would definitely suggest bringing friends for their cocktails and bar bites.

TLDR: New American at Jean George's ABC Kitchen. Modern twists on classic dishes. Fantastic wines, entrees but the $$$$ is spot on.I've been eating at ABC Kitchen for a number of years, I haven't had a chance to try the other ABC sister spots. The restaurant is part of a home store which you'll notice at the back of the restaurant.This is very much a place to be seen. The decor here is beautiful and the food tastes how this place looks, spectacular.If it's your first time, here's my recommendations for a great meal.Crab Toast with Lemon Aioli - It's so simple yet oh so luscious. That lemon aioli just adds to the richness of that sweet crab. Nowadays, who doesn't love anything on toast?!Pretzel Dusted Calamari - I think everyone's had plenty of calamari at some point but that pretzel breading makes this so light. It has that delicate crust that few places seem to accomplish. The two sauces are great, one is a spicy tomato and I think the other is some kind of mustard.Mushroom, Parmesan, Oregano and Farm Egg Pizza - He has similar versions at his other restaurants but this one is my favorite. Let that yolk run over the mushroomy landscape and it's just earthy savory flavors galore. You may want to split an entree if you get one of these - it's quite rich and very filling.Fried Organic Chicken - The breading is so airy and it just crumbles as you slice across the chicken. On a bed of collard greens with hot sauce butter, you can't go wrong with this. Dip every single bite in that butter, it's good for the soul.Akaushi Cheeseburger - This is probably one of my favorite burgers anywhere. The cheese is grated on top as opposed to just a slice across the patty. The fries are fabulous and those peppers give such a lovely kick.ABC has been here for a long time and I trust they'll be here long after. Solid menu that keeps the staples the customers love.The hard part is booking a reservation but fear not, if you walk in on the earlier side - you can snag a bar seat or even a table if you're lucky.

No doubt this is a classy-casual place for dinner. The food was really good for the most part; I would come back. For the price, it's definitely not an everyday restaurant, but good for date night or a special occasion. I had the Crab Toast, Campanelle pasta, and the ice cream (with chocolate sauce and popcorn). Crab Toast: Tasty with a good amount of substance on the toast. For me, the bread was toasted slightly too long; it was a bit hard, but the flavor shined through. The crab topping was creamy and put together nicely. I probably could've eaten 3 slices of this toast. Campanelle: This pasta was absolutely delicious. I only wish I had more of it. The ricotta laid on top of the pasta, waiting for me to spread it around. Once I did, the whole pasta was transformed; it went really nicely with the eggplant and tomatoes. This was an awesome dish. I recommend having the "entree" version and getting more of it; I believe I had the smaller "appetizer" version. Ice Cream: This was just okay. The candied popcorn was very sweet with the ice cream; I understand that it would probably get soggy if it wasn't candied, but it was a little much in this dish. Next time, I would try the chocolate caPrice: 3/5Quality: 4/5Quantity: 4/5Service: 5/5Atmosphere: 5/5

I was so excited to come here with my family to begin the celebration week of my daughter getting married. It's been the most disappointing meal in New York that I have ever sat down for. We sat down for dinner at 7:20 and ordered drinks. Which came very sporadically. The waitress told us to order everything so it could be spaced out. They finally brought us a salad at 9:20. 2 hours for a salad that didn't have to be cooked. Oh yes... the drink my husband ordered (Pernod)!took them 30 minutes to either locate or they went to purchase it. As I'm writing this, 3 out of 5 orders have been served. I'm still missing my dinner. My ravioli came at 9:30. Not bad. The pizza super salty. Hamburger salty. Sea bass was good. Angelo the manager was very understanding and super apologetic. Â We promise to give them a second a chance

I think there are three of them. Three ABCs. I passed through the restaurant of ABC Cocina on my to ABC Kitchen and then the wonderful Emily told me there was also ABCV (the vegan restaurant). ABC Cocina was dimly lit throughout, even making getting to the toilet a serious task on those steps for old four eyes. Back upstairs and had to pass all the couples dining to locate ABC Kitchen and it was like a whole different world. Kitchen is bright and tastefully decorated. (hey there's a decor store above this restaurant, could it be they own errrythang around here?) As I was saying it's chic, modern with a real airy, casual yet elegant feel. From my food selection of crab toast (came highly recommended), calamari and beef burger I enjoyed the burger the best, something I don't say often. Emily said it was some type of special beef but they buried me deep under libations so I cannot to save a life remember a word of what she said about that beef. Emily though, so knowledgeable, accomodating, professional and an overall boss at what she does. Well done sistah! Don't worry, I'ma see your name on my telly soon! Thanks for a wonderful evening. ABC. The End.

I've literally walked by ABC kitchen every day for 5 years and said "I've gotta try that place sometime." "I've eaten at every other great restaurant in Flatiron, why haven't I been to ABC?"Well the other night we finally made it to ABC Kitchen, and damn do we regret waiting this long. We started at the bar. I had a marg which I asked them to rim with their adobo chili salt. My girlfriend and her mother drank wine. The marg was solid, great kick from the chipotle infused salt. The bar was very nice. We were seated shortly after. Our waitress (though I can't remember her name) was an absolutely sweetheart. Not only was she kind and funny but very knowledgeable and opinionated when it came to the menu. We love opinionated waiters because any smart diner knows that nobody knows the food better than the people who serve it and eat it daily, so we often ask for advice when we are having an internal dilemma while choosing between various delicious sounding dishes. With her expertise we arrived at the starting line with the carrot avo salad and the pea soup. The carrot avo salad was honestly one of my favorite but simplest things of the night. The salad was light yet had a very developed flavor thanks to the cooking of the carrots and the application of some kind of delicious oil, though I couldn't tell what, as well as a healthy hit of acid. The pea soup was light and vegetal but very flavorful and satisfying thanks to the addition of mint. Next we immersed ourselves in the steamed artichoke. This thing was a hoss. It was basically an artichoke, completely bloomed open like a flower, steamed to perfection until the heart was fork tender and the leaves nice and soft, and then filled almost like you would fill a bowl with about a quarter inch of spices and a mustard vinaigrette. It was buttery and acidic and just all around divine. We dipped the leaves in the center well of vinaigrette then demolished the heart. The whole dish is edible so we didnt leave a scrap beyond the spent leaves. Highly recommended. Definitely my favorite dish of the night. My girlfriend and her mother split the ricotta ravioli and the campanelle with spring peas and pistachio pesto. I didn't try the ravioli but the campanelle was quite good. Cooked well and the peas were left only partially pureed, some whole, so it added lots of texture. Textbook pasta dish. I ate the black sea bass with chilis and potatoes at the advice of our waitress. It says it comes in a herb broth, but I would call this more of a fumÃ¨. And thats a good thing. This was a perfectly crispy bass in the lightest but most flavorful broth Ive maybe ever had. Perfectly executed with nice globules of glistening fat floating on the surface. My god it was existential. If you're a fish lover (which I'm not necessarily) you must get this. It was easily one of the top 3 fish dishes I've ever had. The fish was so tender and the broth really just set it apart. We ended with the apricot crumble, which was very tasty, sweet but tart from the apricots. And a cookie plate, which I probably would skip next time in favor of some of the more unique desserts on the menu. Overall, service was excellent. The staff were incredibly helpful and kind. The atmosphere was spot on. And we had a lovely dinner. Will absolutely 100% be back soon.

First off, this place is lovely in terms of atmosphere and overall vibe. The bar area is a great place to have a cocktail or sample some appetizers. Went here one evening to meet up with former colleagues. It was early in the week -perhaps a Tuesday, and the place was packed. We were seated at a table and the room got darker fairly quickly. The crowd was great but it was difficult to talk due to the acoustics. Our drinks took forever to come -and no one really checked in on us while we waited. So, once the server came back we quickly put our order in since service was slow. Our appetizers also took forever, and were tasty but smallish portions. The rest of our food also took forever and a day-and were good but nothing fantastic. One of us in our party wanted to change out their cocktail because it was wrong , and we had to wait and wait again for someone to come by, we finally flagged someone ! Service here is sorely lacking and does not match the prices. If you want to venture in save yourself the wait and grab a drink at the bar and an appetizer. Not sure if this is Michelin star-if so, they(michelin star peeps) Â need to revisit that status asap ! Â :)

Quality and service used to be unmatched here. Sitting at bar for brunch at this moment. Bar server obviously does not want to be here - no personality or energy or respect. Drink was good. Ordered eggs Benedict and asked the whites to not be runny or undercooked. Served edible but definitely whites were raw and undercooked. All food served on chipped plate. Disappointing.
The food and service is good. They have an extensive wine list which is great. I recommend the burgers or any pasta they have. Their fried chicken is also really good.

I gave it one star because there isn't another option! I went there on the 12th of December and got food poisoning from their raved burger. Four hours after eating, I was throwing up and stuck to the toilet for hours! After reaching out to them to let them know what happened, no one returned my call!! Horrible service! Stay clear of this place!
